inclusion.criterion: Cirrhosis diagnosed by either of the following in a patient with chronic liver disease
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Radiologic evidence of varices, cirrhosis or portal hypertension
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Laboratory evidence of platelet count <100,000 or AST/ALT ratio>1
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Endoscopic evidence of varices or portal gastropathy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: On treatment for hepatic encephalopathy (patient can be on lactulose and rifaximin)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to give written, informed consent (demonstrated by mini-mental status exam>25 at the time of consenting)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: TIPS in place for less than a month
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Currently on antibiotics apart from rifaximin
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 55-year-old man with Parkinson's disease. He has hypertension and hypercholesterolemia, but no signs of dementia or immunocompromised state.
